result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared W. Mande was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court does not object to an early discharge after completion of 2 years of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Michael R. Schrock and Harley T. Dobbertin, except for contact permitted under juvenile court action.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall not change/terminate his mental health provider without his Agent's approval.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from only one (1) pharmacy and report any changes of medications within 72 hours to his Agent.
Defendant shall prepare a letter of apology to Officer Rodenz and submit to his Agent for approval.

records.addlTxt: elements

DA Snider present.
Def. present - in custody.
Atty. Scott Engstrom present.
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
16 CF 45 - Ct. #1 - NC plea - Ct. #2 is D&RI.
16 CF 61 - Ct. #2 - NC plea - Ct. #1 is D&RI.
16 CM 92 - Ct. #7 - NC plea - Ct. #8 and Ct. #9 are D&RI.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty.
No request for PSI today.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
RHT summary filed w/court - 16 CM 92.
Victim impact statement filed w/court.
Recommendations by counsel.
Probation - SW - 3 years concurrent on 16 CF 45 and 16 CF 61 and 1 year on 16 CM 92.
The court does not object to an early discharge after completion of 2 years of probation on 16 CF 45 and 16 CF 61.
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of action + restitution surcharge of $74.96.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  pay RHT of $749.58 on a joint and several basis w/16 CM 94 and 16 CM 93.
4.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to participate in any other counseling as directed by his Agent - def. to not change/terminate mental health provider w/o his Agent's approval.
6.  def. to possess prescriptions only w/a valid prescription and take in manner & method as prescribed by his physician.
7.  def. not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
8.  def. to obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and report any changes of medications w/in 72 hours to his Agent.
9.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with Michael R. Schrock and Harley T. Dobbertin (except for contact permitted under juvenile court action).
10.  def. to prepare a letter of apology to Officer Rodenz and submit it to his Agent for approval.
66 days credit, if revoked on 16 CF 61.
Court questions def. re:  his residence upon release and any current mental health counseling appointments.
Statements by def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Def. to meet w/P&P today.
